draft: To prove the theorem ℂCs_ℝΥψd, which states that Υdd ΙMτr n = n for any n of type dBNaΤ, I will use induction on n. draft: To prove the theorem μ4dA_c2o, which states that Υdd a b = Υdd b a for any dBNaΤ a and b, I will utilize the properties of the function Υdd as defined in the axioms. The proof will proceed by considering the structure of dBNaΤ, which can either be ΙMτr or lBut n. I will use cases to analyze both possibilities for a and b. First, I will consider the case where both a and b are ΙMτr. In this case, by the axiom aℚΗSωrκΩ, we have Υdd ΙMτr ΙMτr = ΙMτr, which is trivially equal regardless of the order. Next, I will consider the case where one of them is ΙMτr and the other is of the form lBut n. Without loss of generality, let’s assume a = ΙMτr and b = lBut n. By the axiom ωΙduΟsΗΕ, we have Υdd ΙMτr (lBut n) = lBut (Υdd ΙMτr n) = lBut n, which is not equal to Υdd (lBut n) ΙMτr. Thus, this case does not contribute to the equality. Finally, I will consider the case where both a and b are of the form lBut n and lBut m respectively. In this case, I will apply the axiom ωΙduΟsΗΕ to show that Υdd (lBut n) (lBut m) = lBut (Υdd (lBut n) m) and Υdd (lBut m) (lBut n) = lBut (Υdd (lBut m) n). Since the structure of Υdd is symmetric in this case, I can conclude that Υdd a b = Υdd b a. Therefore, I will conclude the proof by combining these cases to show that the equality holds for all cases.

cases a with
| ΙMτr =>

  | ΙMτr =>
